Because their illnesses were cured, they set up much merit and virtue, practiced giving, and revered and respected this elder's son, saying:

Good female heavenly beings!
At that time, the elder's son had a wife named Water-Void Dragon Treasury, and they gave birth to two sons:
One was named Water-Void, and the other was named Water-Treasury.

At that time, the elder's son took these two sons and traveled through the cities and villages in sequence. Finally, he arrived at a large empty marsh and saw many tigers, wolves, foxes, dogs, birds, and beasts that ate meat and blood all rushing in one direction and leaving.
At that time, the elder's son thought like this:
For what reason are these birds and beasts all rushing in one direction?
I should follow behind and observe.

At that time, the elder's son finally followed and saw a pond whose water had dried up. In the pond, there were many fish. When the elder's son saw the fish, he gave rise to a great compassionate mind.
At that time, a tree spirit manifested half of its body and said like this:
Excellent, excellent!
Great good man.
This fish is pitiful. You can give them water. Therefore, you are named 'Flowing Water.'
There are two other reasons for being named 'Flowing Water':
One is able to flow with the water, and two is able to give water.
You should now follow the name and determine the truth.
Then the elder's son asked the tree spirit:
How many of these fish are there?
The tree spirit replied:
The number is complete, exactly ten thousand.
Good woman!
At that time, Flowing Water, hearing this number, doubled his great compassionate mind.
Good woman!

At that time, this empty pond was exposed to the sun and only had a little water left. These ten thousand fish were about to enter the gate of death, rolling around in the four directions. Seeing this elder, they gave rise to reliance. Wherever the elder went, they followed and gazed, never leaving his side with their eyes.

At that time, the elder searched in the four directions, looking for water but was completely unable to find any. He then looked around and saw a large tree. He went to get branches and leaves and returned to the pond to make shade.
After making shade, he further searched for the source of the water in the pond.
He went out in the four directions and searched all around but did not know where the water came from. He then ran even faster to a distant place and saw a large river called Water-born.
At that time, there were also other evil people who, in order to catch the fish, diverted the water from the upper reaches at a steep and dangerous place, not allowing it to flow down;

Moreover, the place where the water was diverted was steep and dangerous, difficult to repair. It was estimated that it would take ninety days and the work of a hundred thousand people to fix it, let alone by myself alone.

At that time, the son of the elder quickly returned to where the great king was, bowed his head in reverence, and then stood to one side. Joining his palms together, he spoke to the king about the causes and conditions, saying these words:

'I have been traveling around the kingdom treating various illnesses for the king and the people. Gradually, I came to an empty marsh and saw a pond whose water had dried up. There were ten thousand fish exposed to the sun. Today, they are in dire straits and will die soon.
I only wish that the great king would lend me twenty large elephants so that I can carry water to save the lives of those fish, just as I have given life to the sick.'
At that time, the great king immediately ordered a high minister to quickly provide what was needed.
At that time, the high minister, having received the king's order, said to the elder:

At that time, the elder's son wandered around the four sides of the pond, and the fish also followed him, swimming along the shore.
At that time, the elder's son had another thought:
